results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
As a Business Analyst in XLD, you should be a collaborative and highly organized individual with customer focus to provide support to different projects. The role involves a capability to analyze the business to identify problems and opportunities and to be able to define solution characteristics. The next Business Analyst must possess outstanding conceptual, analytical, communication, facilitation, and presentation skills with highly developed organization and management skills.

 

Responsibilities

  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • Documentation of Product requirements
  • Slicing of User stories into small, incremental deliverables with complete Acceptance criteria
  • Lead in estimation, prioritization, planning and coordination of development activities, commitments, and timelines
  • Creation of System and User flow diagrams (eg. Flowcharts, Use case diagrams)
  • Works closely with QA team to ensure that all test scenarios are catered
  • Involvement in User acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure the definition of doneness of each deliverable

Requirements

 

  • A good listener, with extreme note-taking capabilities
  • Proficiency in problem solving
  • Must have a keen attention to detail
  • Must be able to handle and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Must have the leadership attitude and mindset
  • Demonstrated experience in Agile/Scrum
  • Must be able to sort through information from multiple sources to funnel correct and concise information to Engineering team
  • Must be able to translate and simplify requirements by documenting User stories and Acceptance criteria
  • Must be able to lead collaboration exercises using different techniques such as User story elicitation, Flowchart / Diagrams to depict process and user flows, and Wireframes
  • Planning and monitoring individual requirements satisfaction
  • Understanding of the principles of Web and Mobile application development
  • A background in Finance industry is a major advantage

Benefits

  • Exciting startup working environment at the forefront of new economic and financial ecosystems
  • Startup aligned incentives that support you in a rapidly growing business
  • Work from Home
  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) subject to company policy
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)

results.title: Senior Business Analyst
results.candidate_required_location: CET (UTC+1), UTC, EET (UTC+2), EAT (UTC+3), AGT/BET (UTC-3), UTC-2, CAT (UTC-1)
results.description:
Who are we?

Distributed is a software development company building the world's Elastic Workforce, reinventing work and challenging the assumption that a local team is the best team.

We help businesses access the best on-demand software teams on the planet, and build freelancer careers on our platform with more benefits than permanent employment.

Having recently signed a £30m partnership with BT, alongside existing strategic investment from Capita, Guinness Asset Management and Fuel Ventures, you'll be working with talented professionals from a diverse set of backgrounds who together are scaling the UK’s Future of Work category leader.

To find out more, head to https://distributed.com/about.

 

 

Responsibilities

  • Owning the sales process from start to finish for large opportunities within large SMEs, Enterprise and government organisations. Developing business plans and coordinating with internal stakeholders on lead generation, own and drive key initiatives and projects to achieve growth and reach sales targets.
  • Working across multiple external customers to analyse needs, define strategic goals and align them to the product roadmap.
  • Develop, scope and define backlog items (epics/features/user stories) that guide the Agile software development team.
  • Work with stakeholders to create and define problem statements leading to root cause analysis.
  • Create and gather requirements from stakeholders, ensuring documentation is complete, understandable, and unambiguous.
  • Develop appropriately detailed specifications for the product features so they are clearly understood by the development teams.
  • Backlog and user story creation with the ability to write user stories for different skill sets, e.g. UX/UI and coders.
  • Ability to work across several squads to fulfil the BA role - when and where most needed
  • Increase an understanding of Agile practices, Lean Startup, new technologies opportunities and other new trends.

Requirements

  • Vast experience in Sales and Business Development space.
  • Significant experience as a Business Analyst, with experience of both startups and enterprise clients.
  • Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills.
  • In-depth knowledge of Scrum and Agile Software Development Methodology.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up your sleeves.
  • Extensive experience working with multi-skilled, cross-functional engineer teams, preferably as part of a professional services team.
  • Proven track record of working with technical teams to deliver products to delight users.
  • User story creation with Gherkin Acceptance Criteria.
  • JIRA, Confluence, Slack.

Compensation

  • Competitive salary (dependent on experience)
  • Performance-related bonus
  • Employee pension plan
  • AXA private healthcare
  • Learning & Development budget for you to grow professionally 
  • 34 days of holiday a year (26 days + Bank holidays)
  • Work from anywhere in the UK or within GMT +/-3 hours time zone; we're a fully remote company

About us

Distributed is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Employees and contractors, as well as prospective employees and contractors, will all be treated equally and fairly. Distributed is committed to ensuring no less favourable treatment is experienced by any current or prospective employee because of any of the protected characteristics under the UK Equality Act 2010 or equivalent local equality legislation. 

By submitting your application you give us permission to store and use the information from your CV and your answers to application questions.

results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
Our health system is broken, and it’s a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.
 
Sana seeks a motivated, highly organized, trustworthy, and experienced executive assistant to work and grow alongside Sana’s leadership team and join our Admin Operations team. Fast growth brings with it a lot of competing priorities; your job is to provide the executive team leverage so we can be more impactful as an organization.
 
In this role, your time will be split as follows:
70% executive team support
20% general company tasks & event planning
10% People Operations team support
 



What you will do
  • Support our executive team with a wide variety of services including strategic calendar management, team event planning, presentation building, travel and expenses
  • Understand business priorities of your leaders in order to best leverage their time
  • Manage and coordinate logistics for internal and external meetings
  • Event planning for executives’ team onsites, remote company initiatives and our annual all-company retreat
  • Manage occasional HR/People Ops tasks 
  • Handling company swag including creating with Designers, ordering and paying invoices with our vendors
  • Flexibility and willingness to contribute to special projects as needed
  • Light support maintaining coworking office space including retrieving mail and coordinating conference rooms
  • Occasional personal work expected



About you
  • 3+ years of experience as an EA or in a similar administrative function
  • Based in the Austin, TX area
  • Outstanding emotional intelligence and efficient communication skills over Zoom, cell, email, chat, carrier pigeon, etc.
  • Extremely organized and 100% reliable
  • Able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Positive, optimistic and enthusiastic attitude
  • Excited about our mission and business potential
  • Fast learner. You adapt to new situations, processes, domains of knowledge quickly
  • High level computer proficiency, including familiarity with tools like Google Apps, Slack, and Zoom
  • Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion. You'll have visibility into a lot of business & personal life details



Benefits
  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options 
  • Flexible vacation
  • Medical dental and vision Insurance 
  • 401k
  • Paid Parental leave
  • Disability leave
  • Wellness program
  • Opportunity for career growth
  • Dynamic start-up environment 
About Sana
Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out!

results.title: Executive Assistant
results.description:
Hello, Executive Assistants!

 

My name is Kurt Schmidt and I am a serial entrepreneur. I'm the owner of Inside The Magic and looking for a rockstar EA to join our team.

 

About the company:


Inside the Magic is the number #1 site online for Walt Disney World, Disneyland, Universal Studios, and more. Plus movie news for all of your favorite Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars films, covering the most interesting, entertaining, and unique entertainment experiences in the worlds of theme parks, movies, TV, video games, conventions, special events, and so much more.

 

About the role:


I'm looking for someone detail-oriented and proactive with excellent communication skills to be my virtual Executive Assistant. I need an A-Player who can be a trusted partner for the long term.

 

This will be a fast-paced role with a variety of different tasks and challenges that present themselves each week. Since this is a remote position, one must be self-motivated, a self-starter, and have the ability to work independently with minimal oversight.

 

This would be a Full-time Remote position.

We are looking for someone that can work in the US time zones.

Benefits:

    • Work with an existing talented team

    • Completely remote schedule

    • Location independence

    • You’ll be joining a high-level and fast-paced team, working with exciting businesses and projects

 

Please note that you’ll be joining a fast pace and high-achieving team. You’ll be held to high expectations and challenged. And you’ll also be supported in your growth in this role professionally as well as personally.


If this sounds interesting to you please proceed with your application. First, answer the below questions in the job post. Shortlisted candidates will receive a 2nd round of questions so I can understand you as a person better. After the 2nd round of questions, you will be invited to perform a paid test project or a remote interview.

 

Thanks and I look forward to hearing from you!

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience working remotely as an Executive Assistant for a business owner/CEO

  • Experience with communication tools like Teamwork and Zoom

  • Ability to multitask and manage multiple incoming requests, while ensuring they are prioritized and handled at the appropriate time and in the correct manner

  • High level of experience with Google Apps, Apple Calendar, Gmail, and similar apps

  • Ability to quickly learn new software applications

  • Ability to handle several emails and requests per day and complete work by deadlines

  • Capability to set up new systems and "standard operating procedures" (SOPs) in order to streamline business and personal tasks

Responsibilities (but are not limited to):

  • Maintain daily calendar, and arrange calls, meetings, and conferences while making sure all details are handled in a clear and organized manner

  • Assist with monitoring my email inbox, including responding to clients, other contractors, and business contacts

  • Assisting me with different spreadsheets and tracking systems

  • Working on different complex tasks (if needed)

results.title: Personal Assistant
results.description:
Strafe Creative is seeking a hands-on, experienced PA to support the Managing Director in ongoing business growth. We’ve been growing steadily over the last few years, working on bigger projects, with more clients and regularly hiring new members of staff. Overseeing the business growth is the Managing Director, who, after 12 years in the role is keen to work with a dedicated Personal Assistant to keep them organised and focused on the ongoing growth of the business.

The Role

Who are we?
Strafe Creative is an independent, award-winning digital design agency, proud to be working on a range of projects, from websites and mobile gaming to SaaS apps and more.

We’re based in Nottingham, however remote working is the new office life these days so this role can be based anywhere, although we’d love to see you in the office once a month or so. We’re a fun, passionate bunch of people to work with and we’d love someone like-minded to join us!

Learn a bit more about Strafe:

  • Who we are and what we do
  • What it’s really like to work at Strafe by the people who work there
  • The Strafe Creative Family Policy, because work isn’t your whole life
  • A sneak peak into how we are always learning and growing


What’s the job then?
As the first PA within the business, you’ll have the opportunity to grow and shape the role as you see fit. Typical tasks will include:


  • Inbox Management & Calendar Appointments on behalf of the MD; filing, prioritising and responding where appropriate
  • Taking meeting notes - to help keep everyone in the loop on sales or client meetings
  • Managing ad-hoc travel arrangements, including flights, accommodation and itineraries
  • Supporting the delivery of ad hoc research and projects in partnership with the Managing Director
  • Updating and creating presentations - so that the MD can focus on looking after the client experience
  • Keeping the Director on track - making sure they attend priority meetings and stick to the business goals and actions
  • Updating the CRM System (Hubspot) to ensure the quality of lead and client data is of a very high standard
  • Updating and managing key sales documents via the Google suite


Sound up your street? Here’s how to apply
Send us a CV, cover letter and a short video no more than 2 minutes long. We're keen to hire a new team member that fits in with us - someone who is a real people person and enjoys working closely with the team.

In the video, please talk about one of the following topics and show us how you communicate:


  • The thing you're most proud of and why
  • Your favourite hobby and why you love it
  • Your best holiday and why


(Hint, we want to see you talking about something you love and how you handle the direction we've provided).

Cover letter-wise, focus on what you would bring to the role and how you would go about managing our busy MD.

Please send all three items to careers@strafecreative.co.uk or use the form at the bottom of this page to submit.

Salary

£24-£28k (Based on experience)

results.title: Senior Value Consultant
results.description:
Vivun is a global provider of Buyer Experience (BX) software. Its AI-powered platform supports a family of products that enables B2B businesses to meet the demands of today’s sales-proof buyer, differentiate from the competition, and accelerate revenue. With PreSales at the forefront of the buyer experience, companies can align Sales with Product, provide repeatable workflows for their solution experts, deliver on-demand product expertise, and win more deals with transparency and trust.
 
Position Summary:
This role is a new strategic position at Vivun that combines value analysis and strategy consulting competencies. We’re looking for an exceptional individual to join our Value Management team as a key player in further developing the Vivun Value Realization Program.
 
In this role, you will work closely with our Sales, Solutions Consulting, Technical Account Management, and Marketing teams to ensure a successful engagement with customers and prospects. You will directly influence Vivun’s largest sales engagements and impact Vivun’s accelerated growth. You will support accounts across all steps in the customer lifecycle, from strategic alignment, project justification, and commercial proposals to value measurement and realization of targeted business outcomes.
 



Key Responsibilities
  • Work closely with the customers, Sales, Solutions Consulting, Technical Account Management, and Marketing to understand how Vivun helps customers meet their strategic objectives by identifying key business drivers and developing compelling points of view to drive an executive-level conversation
  • Identify target operational and financial metrics impacted by Vivun’s solutions and use these metrics to develop ROI / Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) models to quantify the value of Vivun’s platform
  • Build the business value proposition, including developing a strategic account plan, formulating a value hypothesis, building a business case justification, and crafting a compelling proposal to C-Level executives
  • Conduct industry/account research and analysis to help develop a point of view of how Vivun can help customers achieve their strategic objectives
  • Win the trust of Vivun’s world-class sales team to become a trusted advisor and coach on the Value Realization Journey (Selling, Realization, Expansion)



Desired Skills & Experience
  • 3+ years of management consulting experience with a leading consulting firm or 3+ years of value consulting/value engineering at a leading technology company; experience leading engagements, and building new processes & best practices is a plus
  • Strong analytical skills, including mastery of financial modeling and data visualization with an ability to incorporate data into compelling storylines for executive-level conversations
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent in a quantitative field (business, finance, economics, math, engineering, marketing) or related area
  • 5+ years of professional experience; experience in Sales/Industry Solutions/Value Engineering or Business Transformation a plus
  • MBA
  • Excellent executive presentation and communication skills
  • Demonstrated skills in design and facilitation of executive-level workshops - ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various levels of functional knowledge
  • Ability to work across multiple functions/disciplines/cultures/geographies in a highly collaborative and engaging fashion
  • Strong track record of building and maintaining effective customer relationships
  • A self-starter who thrives in a high-growth, fast-paced software company
  • Ability to travel as required (less than 30% typical)



You Are
  • A believer in Vivun’s core values: Ownership. Empathy.  We, not me.  Transparency.  Be different.
  • Experienced working in high growth startup environments: You have the ability to move fast, adapt, and thrive in a dynamic startup environment where you derive priorities, requirements, and goals from company context.
  • Collaborative: You are ready to roll up your sleeves and create strategies that work across roles and departments to achieve company goals. 
  • A Clear Communicator: You effectively and positively present your informed opinions on strategy clearly to multiple teams and areas of expertise. You come with a solid rationale behind every decision you make, you understand the importance of listening as part of communication.



What You Will Have at Vivun
  • Competitive salary and full health benefits
  • Stock Options at a well funded, pre-IPO company on a fast growth track
  • Flexible work schedules and work from anywhere at a fully remote company
  • Unlimited PTO with two weeks designated as “quiet period” each year
  • An experienced team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish your goals

results.title: SAP Business One Consultant
results.description:
About Sapphire Systems:

Sapphire is the largest digital operating transformation provider to the mid-market and mid-enterprise clients. Our mission is to turn operating friction into digital business momentum. Through the passion and expertise of our people, we unlock the cloud-delivered operating platforms, digital user experiences, data analytics, and intelligent automation that transforms our client’s operational performance. We are globally significant partners for SAP, ServiceNow, Automation Anywhere, Infor, Hexagon and AWS, and we have transformed the digital operating capacity, capability, intelligence and resilience of over 1,250 clients in the UK and US through our portfolio of consulting, design, delivery, lifecycle service, and cloud services.


Job Summary:

This key client facing role requires the combination of

  • demonstrable SAP Business One configuration ability and knowledge (version 9.3+).
  • a client-engagement skill set that is both flexible and inspires confidence.

The role operates within the SAP B1 practice and across the many different industries in which Sapphire provides its services. From project mobilisation to go-live, this delivery role is at the forefront of Sapphire work to enhance and transform its client’s operations.

This is a consulting role and as such, whilst the hours resolve around a standard working day for the region, there are times when the job holder will need to work outside these times to assure the project’s progress and success.

Duties/Responsibilities: 

  • Provide guidance with process design.
  • Design, develop, and test automation workflows.
  • Providing implementation consultation and support services during the different phases of SAP Business One implementations, upgrades and other ad-hoc projects.
  • Proficiency with the US and UK SAP localisations; other localisations are an advantage.
  • Proficiency in using SQL-query, views and stored procedures. Proficiency in HANA syntaxis and reporting.
  • Proficiency in the data structures of SAP B1 and any add-ons
  • Customising forms and developing reports using Crystal Reports
  • Perform customizations via Transaction Notification; able to create formatted searches; and other complex system modifications via the Boyum B1 Usability Package; recognising and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions / add-ons and the business practices of the client.
  • Able to encourage the best practice for the client, even if this means the client changing their practices or processes.
  • Designing and conducting master data migration guidance or assistance from legacy systems into SAP Business One.
  • Helping to maintain or update Sapphire’s deployment methodology and share expertise with peers.
  • Prepare well-structured presentations, facilitate design, client training and client workshops or presentations, whether virtual or face to face.
  • Configure and optimise SAP Business One applications and solutions per the design documentation.
  • Able to follow and configure SAP B1 or add-on components from a system design document created by other peers or from a joint design.
  • Undertake unit testing and support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) paying attention to versioning and transition from development and test to production phases.
  • Maintain a project within the agreed scope and assist the project manager in identifying and quantifying change requests
  • Able to demonstrate a basic level of IT infrastructure awareness
  • Confident in presenting and explaining complex ERP or data concepts to the client
  • Demonstrate experience of working in a consulting capacity with clients, including management of time, quality and cost
  • Able to troubleshoot implementation issues and identify the root cause
  • Writing coherent, comprehensive and concise customer implementation and design documentation
  • Demonstrable client engagement expertise and confidence that results in the client asking for the individual by name for further work
  • Adds ideas, improvement and content to Sapphire’s SAP B1 deployment playbook.
  • Demonstrates a flexible work ethic and comfortable working remotely or on-site.
  • Teamwork skills


The ideal candidate will be:

  • Recent SAP Business One Accreditation (9.3 or higher) is highly desirable
  • Boyum B1 Usability package certification is desirable
  • Any other add-on product accreditations are desirable
  • 5 or more years of relevant application consultancy in SAP B1
  • Evidence of working in a consultative capacity with concurrent multiple clients

results.title: Operations Manager, Development
results.description:
Seeking a superstar systems enthusiast to lead on managing data systems, processes, and special initiatives for a team of equally superstar fundraisers. 

 

About the Position

Namati’s Development team has a strong track record of success, including a healthy number of long-time supporters, and significant recent wins enabling organizational growth and long-term sustainability. We are building a dynamic team of seasoned fundraisers to drive the continued revenue growth of Namati. The Operations Manager will be a central player on the team. This leader will manage information systems and processes to allow the teammates to work independently and effectively, while being efficient and coordinated across the organization. 

We seek a teammate who genuinely enjoys, and has demonstrable experience working on, the operations and administrative side of an organization or company. You feel satisfaction when you bring both precision and creative thinking to operational roles. You understand that “behind-the-scenes” work is critical to the achievement of any important mission. Fundraising experience is strongly preferred, but not required for the right candidate.

Our ideal candidate is an impeccably organized, creative, and confident team player. This person should possess exemplary process management and communication skills, outstanding attention to detail, drive to excel in all responsibilities, and capacity to grow in response to the needs of our growing team and organizational budget.

The Operations Manager will report to the Director of Development. Responsibilities include:

Operations

Manage all operational aspects of the Development team. For instance: 

  • Track proposals and reporting processes, collaborating with relevant team members to ensure impeccable, timely submissions.
  • Understand, manage, and improve our existing CRM system (Hubspot).
  • Oversee all shared projects in our project management software Asana, and help the team use the system optimally in  their own workflows. 
  • In partnership with the Director of Development, manage the fundraising forecasting system -- ensure that the forecasting chart is populated with accurate and up-to-date information, for use by both Development and Finance teams.
  • Maintain individual donor gifts processing and stewardship systems.
  • Oversee knowledge management, including filing and tracking all relevant internal and external materials in Google Drive.


Donor cultivation and stewardship: 

  • Manage email communications with funders via Hubspot
  • Research prospective donors and provide strategic recommendations on whether/how to approach the donors 
  • Keep abreast of funding trends to help Namati build and maintain a healthy funding pipeline.
  • Develop and execute creative initiatives to deepen ties with current and prospective donors 
  • Lead Namati’s year-end fundraising campaign  
  • Support and prepare the Director of Development and the Senior Manager of Development for funder meetings.

Here’s what you might have tackled in the past week:

  • Managed communications across several teams to ensure a timely submission for a foundation funder, paying careful attention to all reporting requirements.
  • Scheduled a kick-off call with teammates across multiple time zones for a large submission to a new government funder;  developed a detailed checklist for elements to include in the proposal,  ensured that each element has an owner, communicated any questions to the funder, and carefully read the fine print to confirm our eligibility.
  • Reviewed several online databases for new funding opportunities, flagging any promising opportunities for the Development Director.
  • Track recent donations in Hubspot and ensure that the donor receives a prompt response. 
  • Sent reminders to teammates about several reporting deadlines coming up in the next 30 days, and built a plan to make sure each team will have what they need to complete these reports.
  • Organized a virtual film screening for donors, followed by a dynamic and informative discussion between prospective donors and Namati program leads 

 

About You

  • Organized and an exceptional project manager: You know how to bring together geographically dispersed colleagues at varying levels of seniority (often with competing deadlines and priorities) to get things done. You can monitor all the details across multiple projects while ensuring the larger strategic plan is on track.
  • Exceptional communication skills: Your written and verbal communications evidence clarity of thought, sharpness of analysis, and you’re able to tailor your communications to meet people where they are.
  • Technologically-savvy: You’re a technophile; when working with a new program or application you quickly become fluent. You understand the stakes of securing our data and will do what it takes to protect and optimize it. You have (likely 2+ years) experience managing complex relational databases. Even better if you have experience with Hubspot.
  • Collaborative and service-oriented: You greet everyone you encounter with a collaborative spirit, kindness, and empathy. You like helping the team and serving our communities. 
  • Growth mindset: You’re always seeking to better yourself and your work, and you will push yourself to the peak of performance to help fulfill our mission. In service of that growth, you welcome and delight in feedback from supervisors, peers, reports, and anyone else

 

Location 

This position is remote (partially remote if based in/near Washington, DC) and open to any location in the United States. Please note that candidates must already be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered for the role.

Compensation & benefits
Throughout the hiring process we will seek to understand your specific skills, experience, and abilities as they will fit into our team and our job levels. The offer range for this position is likely to fall between $75,000 - $85,000 based on the final job level determined by the responsibility, scope, and complexity of the position. If you have salary requirements, please note them in your cover letter.

Namati offers an excellent benefits package, including:

  • Health insurance- Namati pays 80% of the base plan premium for individuals, and 50% for dependents
  • 3 weeks' paid vacation, 12 sick days, 12 federal holidays (plus the week between Christmas and New Years), 3 personal days, 6 weeks' parental leave
  • 401(k)- Namati contributes 5% of your salary plus matches your contribution up to an additional 5%
  • Pre-tax withholding for transportation and parking (Washington DC metro area)
  • Access to professional development opportunities


To Apply

Please complete our online application, including a resume and short application question. In the application, please submit a 200 word response to one of the application questions. No phone calls, please. Namati is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 

We'll accept applications until Friday, November 11, 2022. 

-----

Namati’s work has been featured in/on Democracy Journal, Amanpour & Co. New York Times, the Guardian, Devex, WIRED, the Washington Post, among others, and has been documented by the Sundance Institute. Vivek Maru, Namati’s CEO, gave a TED Talk in 2017 which has been viewed over 1.3 million times. In 2016, Namati was honored with the Skoll Award for Social Entrepreneurship and in 2017, the Schwab Foundation named Vivek Maru and colleague Sonkita Conteh two of its Social Entrepreneurs of the Year. Namati has a perfect score, 100/100, on Charity Navigator and has earned Guidestar’s Platinum Seal of Transparency.

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
About Apollo

Founded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 20,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises. Our platform unifies a database of 250m contacts and 60 million business accounts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale. We're also ranked #1 in Satisfaction on G2 Crowd for Sales Intelligence & Sales Engagement and are used by 1M professionals worldwide.

In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability, and closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia Capital in March of 2022 to fuel the next phase of our growth. 

Working at Apollo

We are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence.  Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward.

Role & Team:

The mission of Apollo’s Business Operations team is to bring data insight, operational capability and strategic vision to drive growth and product strategy at Apollo. We partner with the executive team to define Apollo's business strategy, drive cross-functional projects and unlock new growth opportunities. Our team provides strategic perspectives and analytical horsepower to solve critical business strategy, optimization, and operations problems across the organization. 

We are a team of individuals with complementary skill sets. You will work collaboratively across Go-To-Market, Product, Finance and Marketing teams on a variety of strategic initiatives with a direct and quantifiable impact to our P&L. You will identify actionable insights, assess their impact, and lead execution & implementation. As one of the first members of the Business Operations team, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of the function and the overall business.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with key stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, and customer experience to drive product and business strategy by synthesizing insights and setting actionable plans.
  • Drive high-impact cross-functional initiatives such as pricing strategy, strategic investments and geographic expansion.
  • Leverage your business background to design and implement strong systems, processes and company rituals that will drive performance and collaboration throughout the organization.
  • Drive annual and quarterly business and OKR planning cycles with the leadership team to ensure Apollo is focusing and actioning on the most important near-term and long-term priorities.
  • Partner with the leadership team to define and iterate upon Apollo’s vision, mission and product strategy and conduct the requisite market, product and competitive analysis for these critical initiatives. 

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in highly strategic, operational, and analytical environments e.g. business operations, product management, investment banking, strategy consulting, private equity or venture capital.
  • Ability to solve complex business problems, think from first principles, and build scalable processes.
  • Strong analytical skills, including fluency with Microsoft Excel and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, and/or Amplitude. Knowledge of SQL is strongly preferred but not required. 
  • Experience in efficient and rigorous analysis, research and insight generation, and building hypotheses and an action plan. 
  • Proven track record of building strong collaborative relationships with teammates from a variety of backgrounds, geographies and disciplines.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What You’ll Love About Apollo

Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
We’re on a mission to improve health through nutrition. 

At Simple, we are working on improving health through nutrition, because we believe that this is how we can have the biggest impact on the world. Evidence for the links between health behaviors and later disease and ill-health is strong. Effective interventions will enable people to live longer and healthier lives, and Simple is tasked with making this a reality.

Simple is a mobile application that helps people to improve their nutritional habits through various interventions. It combines personalized programs with meal tracking and health insights -- unlocking the path to healthier and happier lives. Launched in 2019, we rapidly grew to a 15M user base and a 100%+ YoY revenue growth. Now moving to a bigger market, we need to find an engineering leader who will help us to build the best product on the market in a rapid-growth company.

We are proud of our people. We believe that the Simple team is the key to our success and the company’s most valuable asset. So, if you are interested in health and wellness, enjoy solving challenging problems, and have always aspired to become part of a global project —  we want to hear from you!

As a Chief of Staff, you will be the CEO’s right-hand person and force multiplier in many instances. Have a significant impact on the efficiency and productivity of the company.

Reporting directly to the CEO. 

Build a healthier world with us!

 

What you’ll do:
  • Be an extension of the CEO;
  • Oversee and manage internal operations: prepare agendas, take notes, and assign action items at weekly meetings; manage the OKR and annual planning processes, support with board meeting prep, manage All Hands meetings;
  • Improves our management system and rolls out changes across the company;
  • Manage CEO’s time allocation closely to ensure it is spent on the top priorities for the company;
  • Partner with Product, Finance, Pricing, and Analytics to prepare analytical and financial reports and metric dashboards;
  • Manage high-priority cross-functional initiatives, ad-hoc support, or longer-term special projects (examples – culture, decision-making frameworks, organizational design);
  • Keep the CEO accountable for commitments while helping keep reports accountable for results;

What we look for:
  • Top management consulting experience or 5+ years of experience at a high-growth tech company preferred;
  • Familiar with current productivity tools (Jira, Asana, Slack, etc);
  • Highly organized, excellent communicator (both written and verbal);
  • Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across departments, as well as an influence at all levels of the organization;
  • Experience with data analysis, budget management, operations management;
  • Proven track record setting up and scaling different processes within a high-growth environment;
  • Strategic thinking, as well as a willingness to lead initiatives through implementation
  • Strong ownership mentality;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Fluency in English;

 

Why you might be excited about us:
  • You will help build a product that improves people’s health & lives through nutrition;
  • You will have a unique perspective across the company. This includes things like joining board meetings, executive staff meetings, and supporting the vision, and strategy setting for the company;
  • Being a chief of staff is a way to accelerate your career growth as you’re shadowing the founder & CEO directly;
  • Incredible insights into the different functions — product, marketing, growth, operations— of a fast-growing tech company and how they all work together;
  • Remote, with occasional business trips (roughly 10% of the time);
  • A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the business;
  • A stock option plan for every employee. When Simple does well, everyone benefits;
  • Top technical equipment, health insurance, relocation program, friendly and highly qualified colleagues, healthy snacks in our office’s kitchen (if you are in Cyprus, London).
